title: Tui Group's chief information officer quits
text:
Tui Group's chief information officer quits 31 July 2015 Save 
Tui Group’s chief information officer is standing down from his role today. 
Mittu Sridhara is leaving the company at the end of July to be replaced in the role by Tui’s current IT director Chris Bayley. 
The departure comes as the Tui Group continues its integration process with a simplified management structure and changing leadership roles. 
Sebastian Ebel, a member of the Tui group executive board responsible for group IT, said: “Mittu has made an invaluable contribution to TUI over the time he has been with us. 
“He had the challenging task of putting in place a clear digital vision, a roadmap with dedicated projects to deliver a digitally enhanced customer experience, as well as key underlying platforms to support this. 
“I have really enjoyed working with Mittu and have admired his work ethic, energy and constant enthusiasm. I wish Mittu all the very best in his future endeavours.” 
Sridhara joined Tui in March 2012 with his main focus being to transform Tui Group into a digital online business that is able to serve its customers “Anywhere, Anytime, Anyway”. 
He is now being replaced by Bailey who joined the Tui UK and Ireland in October 2009 as its director of IT strategy and planning, moving up to be IT director in October 2010. 
Ebel said: “I am pleased to announce the appointment of Chris Bayley as new group CIO. 
“I have been particularly impressed at how Chris has led his team to deliver the Phoenix project, building large technology change across all aspects of the selling systems, tour operator systems and the introduction of customer system capabilities. 
“I am confident that Chris and his team will successfully drive forward our digital agenda, implementing common IT platforms across the TUI Group.”
